-e ---

Vest is a strong root for clothing:

𓎛 𓃀 𓋴 𓋳 húphasma ὕφασμα
𓎛 𓃀 𓋴 𓋳 ha.Vest < harvest haarbast bast 𓃀 𓋴 𓋳

bast < bark

  • 8th millennium bark cloth Çatalhöyük bast fibers from oak => barkcloth Guangxi ⋍5900 BC => Austronesia 3000 BC
    𒁀𒊭𒈬 ba-ša-mu
    𒁀𒊭𒈬 sackcloth

𒆷𒁀𒋗 la-ba-šu l'Vest
𒆷𒁀𒋗 to clothe oneself

𓋳 ה vestimenta (cloth) ⇔ 𓎛 𓃀 𓋴 𓋳 ⇔ 𓋴 𓏠 es + men < g'men garment

𓇋 𓆑 𓂧 𓊌 𓋳 | cloth | bast > ပိတ် pit > ƒtha Faser vest Westen Flusen ⋍ cloth

waš- (to dress up) [IE *wes- (to dress), Hittite weš-, waš-] fashion √vest
owašša- (to dress) [IE *wes- (to dress), Hittite wašanzi- (they dress)] √ vest
